Class Automaton

java.lang.Object
Automaton
public abstract class Automaton extends Object
Represents any one-dimensional, two-state cellular automaton that evolves according to a rule represented by the Rule class.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Steven Dodson

    • evolve

      public int evolve​(int numSteps)
      Evolves the Automaton by the given number of steps.
      Parameters:
      numSteps - the number of steps to evolve the Automaton
      Returns:
      the number of steps the Automaton was evolved by

    • getGeneration

      public Generation getGeneration​(int stepNum)
      Returns the Generation at the given step number
      Parameters:
      stepNum - the zero-indexed step number to get the generation at
      Returns:
      the Generation at the given step number

    • getCurrentGeneration

      public Generation getCurrentGeneration()
      Returns the current Generation. The current generation is also the most evolved generation.
      Returns:
      the current generation

    • getRuleNum

      public int getRuleNum()
      Returns the rule number being used to evolve the generation.
      Returns:
      the rule number of the Automaton

    • getTotalSteps

      Returns the number of steps the Automaton has been evolved.

    • saveEvolution

      public void saveEvolution​(String filename) throws IOException
      Saves the evolution of the Automaton to a file with the given filename.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to store the information
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be created or written to

    • createAutomaton

      public static Automaton createAutomaton​(CellularAutomaton ca, int ruleNum, Generation initial) throws RuleNumException
      Creates an Automaton object given a CellularAutomaton value.
      Parameters:
      ca - the CellularAutomaton value
      ruleNum - the rule number to be used
      initial - a reference to the initial generation
      Returns:
      the reference to the Automaton instance, or null if ca is null
      Throws:
      RuleNumException - if ruleNum is out of bounds for the rule type
